Reviews.Content: Mixed Emotions I have really mixed emotions about our stay. We LOVE independent establishments, but I'm not sure that I would stay at the Olivier House again. We rented the garden suite - a two story room with courtyard, fountain, trees, sitting room, full bath w/tub and kitchenette on the first floor and spiral staircase leading to a loft bedroom and full bath w/shower on the second floor. It sounded so funky and fun...but fell a little short. Some cons...the trees were over-grown (making it hard to enter the room), the fountain didn't work, the bath tub drain didn't close and the coffee maker was missing. Minor things. Some major things though...the lock was so flimsy (you could literally push the door open when locked) and the second story floor (especially around the vanity and shower) felt like it was going to cave in. BUT some pros...the location was great (so close to Bourbon, but you couldn't hear a thing!!), the courtyard was nice, the staff was helpful, and the parking was free (though there aren't in/out privileges). With a little TLC and a good cleaning - the room would have been awesome. But all in all - though I wanted to, I didn't love it. One great recommendation though...eat at Elizabeth's in the Bywater area. A FANTASTIC breakfast...our best meal of the weekend!
Reviews.Author: Suz-Q73

Reviews.Content: Health  I booked this hotel over the phone as New Orleans was experiencing high demand due to a medical conference. I believe the room allocated was a one bedroom suite. Upon entering the room there was a strong musty smell, I received an electric shock turning down the air conditioning and turning off a lamp in the bedroom, there was only 1 glass in the wet bar which was a dirty champagne glass, there were no clean glasses, coffee cups or coffee although the wet bar was equipped with a coffee maker. After requesting these basic articles be sent to my room, housekeeping arrived to inform me, I was to clean the dishes myself, even though there was no dishwashing liquid, plug or sponge either! The toilet ran constantly, I stood in 3 inches of brown water in the shower, which the tiles were cracked and mouldy and when I sat down to watch the television in the lounge area a mouse ran across the room!!!I went downstairs and voiced my issues to the manager, who immediately became defensive and chose to take my grievances as a personal attack rather than addressing the serious health and safety issues and then proceeded to tell me it would be preferrable that I check out the next day.I have worked as a Director of Sales in the hospitality industry for 5 years and the travel industry for 20 years and would have been sacked on the spot if I spoke to my guests or clients in that manner. I was shown two other rooms to chose from after the rodent issue and neither of these rooms were any better. The door locks are extremely flimsy and most do not even offer a chain lock as added security once you are inside the room. I would strongly disuade people from staying at this hotel until these issues are addressed and basic safety measures are implemented, however based on the managers attitude, I doubt this will happen anytime soon.
Reviews.Author: Futuretravels

Reviews.Content: The New York Pool Party Loves the Olivier House!!!       In the courtyard at the Olivier House
Reviews.Author: KIMMIELOVIN

Reviews.Content: Very Friendly and Helpful We stayed at Olivier House for four nights when we had to evacuate for Hurricane Ike. This was the ONLY hotel that would accept our two small dogs...and they didn't even charge a deposit or nightly charge per dog! They are VERY pet friendly. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They did everything they could to make our stay pleasant. We declined housekeeping,( for fear our dogs would try to escape), and had no problems getting towels or anything else we needed whenever we asked. Room was not what you'd get at the Crowne Plaza, but it was very comfortable, clean, and had a refrigerator. We are planning a trip back to New Orleans for Mardi Gras, and hope to be able to stay at Olivier House then also.
Reviews.Author: chesneydale

Reviews.Content: Another Wonderful Visit...       Parlor
Reviews.Author: DA35

Reviews.Content: Girls Night Out @ The Olivier House       The Olivier House Hotel
Reviews.Author: kasey43067

Reviews.Content: Depends on the room you get Well, after seeing the hotel website it seemed like a nice choice, a little kitch and quirky but thought it might be a nice experience. Booked 2 rooms, one for my boyfriend and I (room 101) and one from my brother and his wife (room 201).Hotel itself is nothing like the website. It was quite dirty and messy and the hotel staff told me they were remodeling. There were lots of plastic bags stashed to the side of the staircase. The carpet was really old and dull. Definitley needs replacing. My room was below average...very very old, stained old wallpaper, stains on the celing, old bedcothes. the towels were awful, and smelt horrible. bathroom was also strange, had an actual curtain for the shower-curtain. The bed wasn't great and the head board was completely broken and had an old pillow behind it to keep it from banging against the wall.We had cockroaches in the bathroom, huge ones at that. Really disgusting. When I called reception to move rooms, I was told that the hotel was full, nothing they could do. In the morning I asked again, and the response was they would put a bug bomb in the bathroom. I went off on a day trip and returned around 4pm when I bumped into the housekeeping lady who knew nothing about the bug bomb. All very unprofessional. I was told they would bring a glue trap and hide it behind the strange sideboard come sink. i couldn't bear to check again if they actually put it there.The good point is the location, really close to burbon street where all the action is.Note: My brother  his wife stayed in room 201 which was much much nicer and seemed cleaner, which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1. They had a nice four poster bed and period furniture in the room and clean modern bathroom. Bathroom in 101 is obviously a safe haven for breeding cockroaches....yuck!
Reviews.Author: gingernutla

Reviews.Content: Strongly suggested Last summer myself, mom and godmother stayed in one of the 'suites'. It was my third time visiting New Orleans and I always stay in the French Quarter area and never in chain hotels, and I must say this was by far the best stay. The staff are all amazing and will do everything to make you feel at home. They do so many extra's and never any added charges for your stay or needs. Our A/C had been running for days so it had froze up and was not working, in the meantime, incase it didn't work they saved us another gorgeous suite with a giant fountain and courtyard inside the room! Fortunately our A/C did just need to defrost and all was good. The entire property is just beautiful! The courtyard is gorgeous, the pool is clean and great to swim in. Every inch of the place has something unique to admire. There is even a tiny, but old elevator that has room for 1 or 2 with luggage. Our room was a loft style suite that is streetside with a balcony, 2 beds + hide a bed, mini fridge, toaster, microwave, coffee maker,plenty of closet  storage space, a huge bathroom with separate shower and soaker tub, fireplace, 2 televisions, one in the upstairs and one on the main floor. The rooms were clean  the decor perfectly suited. We stayed for a week so it was nice to settle in and it never felt like you were in a hotel. It was more than one would expect for the incrediblely reasonable rates thay have, especially in the off season.Not that there were any problems but I would suggest ear plugs if you are streetside due to the noise from garbage pick up and street maintenence. Also, we had about 6 cockroaches which were easy to catch and release, but if you leave your balcony door open they will fly in at night. It is not a sign of filth it is nature!I recommend Olivier House to anyone who will respect the uniqueness, attention to details and love that is experienced in such a place. Support NOLA and visit!
Reviews.Author: nolakitty

Reviews.Content: Don't Stay Here! Just a word of warning: This hotel will disappoint you. If you have a balcony room, beware. It was so unsturdy that we put one foot out and stepped right back inside. We were fearful it would fall right off the side of the building! When we got in bed for the night, the frame fell apart and one side of the mattress landed on the floor. When we called for assistance, we were told that no one was available until AM. We had to pull the mattress to the middle of the floor to sleep on it. Needless to say, we didn't sleep well at all. And don't even think about parking. You can't take your car out until you leave. They squeeze the cars in so tightly you better have really good insurance for repairs. Oh well, so much for a happy birthday! HA!
Reviews.Author: rlcmcm

Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff This is not the Holiday Inn, but the hotel offers reasonably priced accommodations a half block from Bourbon Street in the middle of the French Quarter. Our room was clean and roomy with a nice view of downtown New Orleans. The room had a sitting area with a couch, refrigerator and microwave. We picked up several meals at the Toulouse Deli which is only a few steps from the hotel, and then ate in the hotel's courtyard. Free parking was a nice plus. The hotel has tons of character, but if you are looking for sparkly and brand new, then look elsewhere. We will definitely stay at the Olivier House again when we visit the Crescent City.
Reviews.Author: tnoccther

Reviews.Content: A New Orleans Jewel -- and Pet Friendly! The Olivier is a comfortable, convenient, delightfully atmospheric and PET FRIENDLY hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. We stayed for three days in March 2008, and would enthusiastically recommend it to friends. Indeed, we hope to go again ourselves. First off, the hotel is pet friendly -- unusual for charming small hotels, as other pet owners will know. How glad we were to spend our New Orleans time at a place like this, rather than a chain!Second, the hotel has free, locked, off-street parking -- we were able to forget about the car, and enjoy the city.Third, the structure of the hotel is charming. It has been put together out of a group of old townhouse, and laces around interior courtyards and up and down staircases. The decor is 19th century enough to fit the building, and comfortable enough not to dissapoint modern tourists. Our room -- on two levels with a loft bedroom, a living room and kitchenette, and a big balcony window -- was very pleasant and very well maintained.Finally, the owner and the staff are welcoming and helpful.Particularly in the light of its reasonable prices, the Olivier is a jewel in New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: annbury

Reviews.Content: Quirky, eccentric, interesting! We volunteered with Habitat for Humanity last week and the Olivier House by far had the best deal. Every room is different from the next. My room had a closet door instead of a bathroom door, the bed post was leaning over and the bed was not comfortable! Not the nicest place I've stayed! A friend of mine had a different room and his was pretty rock star compared to mine...except there was no bathroom door, which isn't a big deal for some people, especially if you're staying alone. The employees there are nice and you can hear some interesting stories. While quirky and not the nicest place ever, we definitely said we'd stay there again because it was an experience and gave us more stories to tell!
Reviews.Author: Coffee_Queen08

Reviews.Content: Love This Place! My friend and I travel to New Orleans several times a year, and this is the only hotel we will stay in. The location is unbeatable. The staff is courteous and show great Southern hospitality. If you are looking for the typical antiseptic hotel room, this isn't the place for you. The rooms are quirky, as is the hotel layout, but that only adds to the charm. And sitting on the balcony listening to the music from Bourbon Street. You cannot beat that. If you want real New Orleans and to meet real, geniune folks this is the only place to stay. The charm more than makes up for the lack of amenities.Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: GroovyStig

Reviews.Content: A Dose of New Orleans Charm My family has been to New Orleans many times and we love the city. We have always stayed with a friend. This year we came for a wedding and there were many of us. We booked 6 rooms at the Olivier House, including the Bridal Suite for the Bride and Groom the night of the wedding. We loved all the aspects of the Olivier House. We loved the nooks and crannies, the lovely greenery, the staff was fantastic and our rooms were incredibly unique, authentic and charming. I will come back to the Olivier House and recommend it to all. Oh, and there is off street parking-a serious plus in the Quarter.
Reviews.Author: graywacke

Reviews.Content: Not for the Fragile My husband and I live in New Orleans. Whenever we want to get away and pretend we're tourists, we head for The Olivier House. We have had OK to wonderful room experiences there but we have found that the staff always makes it worth our while and if we've had trouble with a room, they go out of their way to accommodate us either by fixing the problem or moving us to another (usually better) room. I have to admit, we haven't stayed in all the rooms (there are quite a few) but between us, our friends and family, we've seen more than our share. We've had some great ones and some pretty shabby ones but, we wouldn't stay anywhere else.Specifically, the Olivier House is a walk back in time. Some might complain that she isn't up-to-date, but that is the essence of our city and something, in some ways, we're proud of. I've found that the Olivier House embodies all that is wonderful and awful about New Orleans. It just makes us love this place and this city all the more.
Reviews.Author: nolalily

Reviews.Content: Great location, awful room! We chose the Olivier House because it was close to the wedding we attended. The location was very convenient for us, since it was only a couple of blocks to the Cathedral, and Bourbon St but the room was very old, stained carpet, noisy, floors are squeaky, ac was loud, and had an old funk smell to it. Oh...and no TV in room!We would not stay here again, but would look for something in the same area.
Reviews.Author: chamie01

Reviews.Content: True Southern Hospitality While down in New Orleans, volunteering in St. Bernard's parish rebuilding houses, we stayed at the Olivier House. It was a great experience. Because we were working with AmeriCorps, they gave us a 50% discount and really went out of their way to help out. We were driving a big truck with all our tools and although they didn't have much room in the FREE parking garage, they moved all the cars around in order to fit us. This was not an easy feat and we were truly appreciative of their help. The hotel is a really cool, French style hotel. The room was a bit lacking with no toilet paper (not even a fixture on the wall where the toilet paper would have been), a broken shower door, and airconditioning that was so cold and actually dripped water from the ceiling onto your head, but hey, we weren't interested in doing too much sleeping. We were there to work hard and enjoy the scene late into the night.
Reviews.Author: sf-drkeith

Reviews.Content: Loved this place, will return My husband and I stayed at the Olivier House late in May, 2007. I was on business, but opted for this creole experience over the conference hotel a few blocks away. After all, we were in New Orleans and we wanted to experience New Orleans, not the chain hotel experience we've had and hated.We stayed in the Cottage and loved the courtyard, the high ceilings in the suite and the brick flooring. The whole place is a vision, and so very New Orleans. The pool located right out the door was also a nice reprieve in the late afternoon.I can't say enough about the staff and how wonderful they were. I fell in love with the housekeeper and so hated to leave. She was the essence of New Orleans, complete with hugs and that wonderful New Orleans drawl. Only recommendation I would make, is stay during the week and depart on the weekend. That way you will avoid rowdy weekend party people, and loud street noises. This place is close enough to Bourbon Street to be convenient and in the center of the Quarter which makes it very walkable to just about anywhere you'd want to go. By the way, with NO's emphasis on law enforcement presence in the Quarter, we always felt safe and used common sense caution, just as you would at home. We recommend the Olivier House if you want the real New Orleans experience. And next trip to the Big Easy, we'll be staying at the Olivier House.
Reviews.Author: Oliverocity

Reviews.Content: A purelyfrench quarter experienc I am currently staying at the Olivier House and i love it. I have read all the reveiws on this cite and was very suprised at the poor reports of some of them. This may be becuase the hotel is not like most hotels, for example: no two rooms are the same and they are not all organized into nice boring little hallways. In fact i find the hotel to be quite charming with friendly proffessional staff and a great location. I would definatly recomend it to anyone looking for a hotel in the Quarter.
Reviews.Author: Irrelevant

Reviews.Content: Get your rate in writing! Don't use the pool! We booked this hotel by calling the hotel directly. We called in February to book for a visit in May, so we were calling well ahead of time. When we called, they took our reservation and quoted us a rate of $80/night. I asked for a confirmation at the time and they said that they didn't send out confirmations. I thought that seemed a bit odd, but was glad to have a good rate and decided not to worry about it. Well, I should have gotten the rate in writing because when I arrived at the hotel, the rate they charged was $190/night! My husband and I told them that this was not what we were told, but *since we didn't have it in writing* we had no way to prove it. What I think happened was they quoted us the $80 rate back in February, then Jazzfest got scheduled during that week we were there and they upped their rates accordingly. This was one of those live and learn moments for us, but I do think that the hotel should always give their quotes in writing.Also, when we were there, we obseved one of the staff cleaning the tiles in the inside rim of the swimming pool with Comet cleanser - which I am pretty sure isn't good to get in one's eyes.We won't be running back to the Olivier House anytime soon. We felt scammed. I agree with the other reviews on here about condition, too. There were three bags of trash in the hallways near the elevator for the entire three days we were there. Same bags of trash - we tripped over them every time. Little stuff like that - it's just not worth it.
Reviews.Author: winonuh

Reviews.Content: Shabby firetrap This hotel was shabby and dirty. Worn out stained carpets  drapes, peeling wallpaper, old bathroom fixtures, and paper thin walls.Also, it is a fire trap as it is so cobbled up and has been remodeled (not recently tho) so many times it is like a rabbit warren trying to find your room. Not sure how they pass the fire marshall's inspection. The only thing going for it is the location. The location is good and the staff and family that owns this place are nice people. Other than that it is a real dump. Frankly, it needs to be bought out by some hotel company that can totally upgrade this place, cause the location is sweet but it needs major major remodeling.
Reviews.Author: austinsoccerguy

Reviews.Content: Love NOLA, hated Olivier House Did not like this hotel, wallpaper pealing off walls, old, old, old towels, blankets and pillows, I had a loft that was slanted and thought it was going to fall down, carpet was old and stained, shower was hot, cold, hot, cold could never control the tempature, oh yeah there is burgandy carpet in the BATHROOM!! I have never seen carpet in the bathroom! Big hole in the wall where the door handle hit it, kitchen floor was pealing off and they covered it with a rug. I could go on and on... the good part is the staff was very nice but with all your choices in NOLA pick some place else.
Reviews.Author: cdblues

Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff!!! Okay, technically we didn't stay at the Olivier -- it was Jazz Fest and they were booked. However, let me tell you what their wonderful staff did for us . . .A gentleman driving next to us as we exited I-10 could tell we were lost and offered to let us follow him to the French Quarter. We did not have reservations anywhere, had no idea about parking, etc. We followed him to the Olivier (he was either an owner, a family member or a staff member -- it was never clear), where they parked our car in their tiny garage for free. They let us leave it there while we wandered the French Quarter for hours and they made calls to other hotels looking for a room for us. When we returned late in the day, they had booked a room for us at a neighboring hotel (not worth noting -- nothing grand, but clean and safe and probably one of the only rooms left in the city). They were wonderful -- went out of their way to help us and they gained absolutely nothing by it (except perhaps this write-up). I can't speak about the quality of the rooms, but the atmosphere is fantastic and the staff are remarkable.
Reviews.Author: gypsynw

Reviews.Content: Second stay even more fabulous than the first!       Upgraded bathroom
Reviews.Author: lzee1

Reviews.Content: I loved the Olivier House! In June of 2005, I stayed in a hotel near the French Quarter for two nights. I enjoyed New Orleans so much, that I decided to stay another night. However, I wanted a hotel much closer to the entertainment of the F.Q., so I did a little shopping around (on foot.) I found that the Olivier House was very close to Bourbon St., was one of the very few hotels with free parking in the F.Q., and was very affordable and beautiful.  When I was ready to explore, I was literally steps away from the action. The location is excellent if you are interested in architecture, culture, or entertainment. And if your spirits get too high, you can safely walk the few steps back to your room. I have to admit, the idea of leaving my keys with a hotel staff member made me a little uneasy at first. But, he patiently and politely answered all of my questions about safety, accessibility, and incidental history. It was a tight squeeze to fit my car into the parking area, but a staff member soon safely rearranged all of the cars. I do recommend that you plan to leave your car in the parking area during the entire stay. Once I was ready to leave the hotel, my car was at the very back of the area. I simply requested that the staff member back it out for me, and then I closed my eyes as he gracefully squeezed past the other cars. He was very professional and helpful. So, for free parking in the French Quarter, what more can you ask? The Olivier was also one of the most affordable hotels that I priced near the F.Q. (After a couple of fun days in New Orleans, you will probably be looking for affordable too!) The inside of the hotel was historically beautiful. The courtyards were very serene and exuded the Big Easy atmosphere. I felt very comfortable and safe in my room and every other part of the hotel.  I had a balcony room just off of Toulouse St. The room was very spacious, clean, and insect and rodent-free. The furniture was a mix of antiqued and modernized detail: the bathroom sink was an antique dresser of drawers with a modern marble top. The unworldly traveler might mistake the bedroom decor for old, ragged, or dirty. When, in fact, it was none of the above. It simply had the illusion of the 1800's Creole culture, which I found very charming! As for the noise -- in the New Orleans French Quarter, do you honestly expect silence? If so, you are in the wrong part of town. The noise didn't bother me one bit. As a matter of fact, I slept with the window open just for the pure joy of a different world. All in all, I would not have such fond memories of New Orleans had I not happened upon this wonderful hotel. I have already recommended it to many of my family members and friends. I am already ready to revisit!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: French Quarter charm at it鈥檚 finest! We stayed at the Olivier House Hotel from June 17 to June 20. When we checked in, we were upgraded at no charge to a junior suite with a balcony overlooking the courtyard. For the complainers, the room, bath  all the furniture was spotlessly clean and none of the linens were old, let alone worn out. The bath was roomy, marble tiled, floor and walls, and there was NO mildew. The building is almost 200 years old. It鈥檚 creaky. This is New Orleans. It鈥檚 humid. Mildew happens. The only noise we heard was from people talking loudly in the hall outside the room and someone running a vacuum once. No noise from the street came through to the courtyard side.Our sitting room had a small couch, chair, TV, refrigerator and a ceiling fan. The bedroom was in a loft up a short flight of stairs. The A/C was in tiptop shape! The staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous. They answered all our questions, gave great directions and were just plain nice folks. When I called to make reservations, I asked about the parking. I was told it was secure, free, limited space and no in-and-out. It was a tad scary backing the car out, but if we鈥檇 needed another car moved, it wouldn鈥檛 have been a problem. All the places with valet parking also charge $20-$30 a day. If you want a luxury hotel with 350 count linens, stay at W or the Ritz. If you want a cookie cutter hotel, stay at the Ramada. If you want French Quarter charm at it鈥檚 finest, stay at the Olivier House. Thanks y'all!John  Charlee Griffith
Reviews.Author: CharleeG

Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Olivier The Olivier Hotel has one pro...it is only 1 block from Bourbon St. A friend recommended the place as historic, cute and charming with free parking, the Olivier is anything but. The free parking meant our car was blocked in for the weekend and cute and charming meant mouse and roach invested with worn out sheets and towels, bad plumbing, and rooms smelling of mildew. The doors to the hallways and balconies barely stayed shut with broken locks and the hotel had zero security. Zero insulation meant hearing every noise and sound from bourbon street as well as the hotel. Every room is different, but the 3 we tried over the weekend were all in terrible condition. Especially the honeymoon suite. And the management was slow and unconcerned with the rodents, having only one person available at this 40+ room hotel. Stay at the Ramada Inn next door. For the same price as our bad experience at the Olivier, the Ramada offers valet parking, security, clean  quiet rooms, and a helpful staff.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loved it! Great price! Welcomes Southern Decadence guests with open arms! This place is great and they usually have great rates too being that is so close to Bourbon Street. Staying there again this year during Southern Decadence for the 4th year in a row. The staff are very hospitable and they treat you like family. The courtyard pool is a great place to sip a cocktail and chat with others...
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel: clean, charming  Stayed 4 days at Olivier House in March 2005. To contradict other posters: room and bath were clean and well-appointed. A/C worked. Bath was newly redone with marble floor and marble vanity top. Sheets were absolutely clean; lots of fresh towels cheerfully delivered every day. Furnishings are old wood pieces  charming. Did not experience any bugs. There is a lovely patio with large tree  twinkling lights at night. You feel completely welcome to sit there (or in lobby) with drink and relax. It was too cold for pool, but that also looked pleasant (and was filled with clear, clean water). Parking is available (very close) but do not expect to get your car in and out. When hotel is full, they do cram cars in and if you take your car out, there may be no room for it when you get back. But you can walk to anything in French Quarter and streetcars and cabs are readily available. We would definitely go back. PS Take the boat and visit the Zoo. It's worth the trip!
Reviews.Author: nick_jo

Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but the price is right at the Olivier We will stay at the Olivier again, but realize for the price you have to lower your expectations. If you want high-class, you'd better pay the price and stay elsewhere. We love the atmosphere, which is a bit grimy, but that's what I expect and enjoy when we go to New Orleans! If you have a problem with the Maple Leaf, Rock'n Bowl and Tipitina's, you'll have a problem with the Olivier. But if you're after genuine NO atmosphere, you'll love the place. Our only problem (and not a small one) was the cockroaches at night! They are a real scare to us from the Midwest, but we'll still stay there again, with a plan to keep the cockroaches out! (I hope they tell use what we need to do!)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Take a trip back in Time! I stayed at the Olivier House from 2/3 thru 2/10/05 for Mardi Gras. The hotel is beautiful. Staying there is like taking a trip back through time. The hotel has a lush courtyard and our room (#108) was perfectly hidden away from the craziness of Mardi Gras. It was a perfect retreat after hours of partying!! Our room had a remodeled bathroom and two four-poster beds. The room's furnishing were like those you'd see at your great-grandmother's home. The location was perfect and the owners of the hotel are very attentive. I had friends who came over to our room and fell in love with the hotel....not to mention being upset that they paid much more for rooms that were not as nice at other hotels. I am telling all of my friends about the Olivier House. The highest review I can give of the hotel is to return for another stay...and we'll be doing just that in April for Jazz Fest!
Reviews.Author: blackmistressdiva

Reviews.Content: Loved it! Stayed in the hotel for a romantic weekend and loved it! It was in the middle of everything, and the staff was excellent. It's certainly not your cookie cutter chain hotel - yes, it's an older building in the French Quarter - but it's real New Orleans. I thought it was great - and we had the best time. I would definitely go back again. If you want to truly experience New Orleans, this is the place to stay.
Reviews.Author: aimeenola

Reviews.Content: Wedding Memories I have to say it will always have a special place in our heart because the OH was where we were married in 1986! It made a beautiful and quaint place to have a wedding (I came down the winding stairs!). They accommadated our wedding guests - and everyone loved it. It is a very special place and they did everything to make our day lovely! The other person was right - its not your run of the mill place - but a place for lovely memories!
Reviews.Author: Annie055

Reviews.Content: Totally French Quarter! Charming hotel! Forget the chain hotels - feel like you're visiting your Aunt and stay at the Olivier House! Great location, cozy room, great price. We had a very large clean room, fireplace, great view of downtown. Paint was cracking, toilet made unusual noises but so what - we experienced the real French Quarter!
Reviews.Author: MaryHB

Reviews.Content: Great. Like staying at a friend's My first stay at the Olivier was for Jazz Fest 2003. I recently stayed again for business. I think the Olivier is great. It is an old, historic French Quarter building in humid New Orleans and with that comes certain things. The hotel shows its age and the sheets may not match, but they're clean. When I stay at the Olivier I don't feel like I'm staying in a hotel, I feel like I'm staying at a friend's house in the Quarter. No, the Olivier isn't for everyone, but if you like places with character it's a great place to stay. Musicians agree and so does a certain actor from HBO's Sex and the City. Ask for rooms by the pool, or the Creole Cottage. The only down side about the Olivier House is that one must cross Bourbon St. to get there. I can't stand Bourbon St. Bourbon St. is not New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: MEPM

Reviews.Content: Strange and Wonderful The Olivier House is one of my favorite places to stay in NO. I spend 5 days there every year for Mardi Gras. Granted you'll have to put up with peeling wallpaper, old mattresses, leaky windows and falling plaster, but the hotel has some wierd charm that makes it all worth while. There are plenty sterile places to stay in the Quarter but something about walking on the same floors that were walked on 200 years ago appeals to me. Not for the anal-retentive traveler. Every stay is an adventure. You will be treated like family.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: An Awful Hotel This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I will never stay there again or recommend it. The elevator was so small that a person and luggage would not fit. It had to be entered from an outside corridor in the rain. We had to take the stairway four floors. The first room was dirty (dust on furniture, floor and curtains). The bathroom looked as if it had not been cleaned. I am not sure the bed lines were fresh, they appeared to have been bought at a Goodwill store. The bed sagged so that it appeared like a hot dog bun. The entry door had a large crack. We were moved to an attic room that had a leaking lavatory (it puddled in the floor) in the bathroom, no shower curtain or door. The bed was only a little better than the first room. The couch was so dirty one did not want to sit on it. The AC could not be regulated so it was cold all weekend.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Always great I have stayed at the Olivier House several times and have been more than pleased with the service and accomodations every time. It is a quaintly beautiful little hotel in the heart of the french quarter, oozing with charm. It is not the lap of luxury and it doesn't pretend to be. However, it does provide an old world elegance not found in boutique hotels that are twice the price. If you are looking for a uniquely wonderful New Orleans experience a stones throw from Bourbon Street look no further.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great hotel Have stayed at the Olivier House on several occasions and have loved it everytime. The hotel is vintage New Olreans. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very accomodating. If your wanting a five star hotel then go to the Hyatt. If you looking for a nice hotel located in the heart of the French Quarter, look no further, the Oliver House is for you.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Filthy. Broken down. Hotel was filthy. Toilet didn't flush well. Velvet drapes hung to the floor and completely covered the window unit so we burned up at night. Tub didn't drain so showers were taken in 6 of standing water. No shampoo. Under bed, toilet, tub all filthy. Light in bathroom didn't have a switch; it had a cord that had to be plugged in. Does that even meet fire codes? Mattress was ancient and miserable. Bed had very loose post. No price is low enough for this place. It was recommended to me and I stayed against my intuition. Next time, I'll be at one of the many clean and comfortable guest houses or hotels in N.O. Quaint is not the same as nasty. This place is nasty.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Experience! Staying at the Olivier House was a great experience! We loved this charming old town house, it was actually my second time staying there, and I plan to go back again in October. If we needed anything, we just asked for it and they brought it to us. I found the staff to be extemely friendly and I loved hearing some of the old stories about the house. The court yard is beautiful and the decor in our room was cute. If you want generic, stay at one of the big hotels, if you want old world charm this is truly the place to stay. See you in October!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Olivier House big disappointment Dingy, dirty, no services and lots of bugs. Don't stay here!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Neat Freaks would be happier elsewhere The location and hospitality were top notch. But you can get the authentic New Orleans experience with a cleaner room and sturdier furniture. I have stayed at several hotels in the quarter and this is neither the best nor the worst. The architecture is beautiful and truely unique, like many of the old quarter hotels. If you go often, and love to see these old buildings, I would suggest you try it out. Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expected NO to be Alright, I read all these reviews and was very nervous to stay at the Olivier house, but decided to take the chance anyway. Loved it! Yes, New Orleans is BELOW sea level and is right on the water and is a very humid climate so WHY would you NOT expect a little mold? From some of the reviews I read, I imagined mold on the counters, mold in the pool, mold everywhere. I imagined toilets that were too disgusting to sit on etc. There was a little bit of mold in a crack here and there. duh. The bathrooms were very clean. The sheets and bedding was very clean. The carpets were a little musty from the climate and because there was no fan in the bathroom. The hotel is VERY charming and exactly what I expected my first trip to New Orleans to be. The staff were very polite and accomodating as well. Isn't the whole point of travelling to experience something new? If you want a homogenized experience, why leave home?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Like staying in an abandoned house or homeless shelter First I will say that OH is the worst place I have ever stayed. I had reservations at a well known hotel but decided, since my travel companions had never been to NO, that maybe something more funky would be better. I was wrong. My first clue as to how bad it was should have been when the cab driver who appeared to have issues with cleanliness commented on how nice OH was. We were escorted to a room with 2 four poster beds that were broken and the posts glued ot taped back on it was filthy, moldy and dark. I was also concerned about a strange mirror that looked like a two-way mirror used in interrogation rooms. The bathroom looked like it possibly had not been cleaned in months.The staff was nice but strange. I felt like I was trapped in an episode of Scooby Doo. We lasted the 2 nights and made the best of it but...I could have had better accomadations at the homeless shelter. It was so bad that we took pictures to show people back home how awful it was. definitely won't be back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Funky - NOT THE Holiday Inn - anbd thank God for That! If your tastes are very white bread, then stay away - go to the Holiday Inn. But if you like a place a little off-beat  VERY New Orleans then the Olivier House is perfect.This slightly mouldering Grande Dame of a Creole Mansion is located right off Bourbon street in the heart of the Vieux Carre but far enough off to where it is pretty quiet in the courtyards.Jim and Kathy the owners are friendly and very, well, accommodating. To the folks who had problems - I say SPEAK UP! I've stayed there many times since the late 80s and anytime there was a problem it was addressed as long as I told them what I wanted/needed and didn't expect them to read my mind.The Olivier House has been a favorite since the 1970s of traditional jazz musicians. One side benefit of this is that during the music festivals (French Quarter Fest, Jazz  Heritage Fest , and I suppose now the Satchmo Fest) you will sometimes find impromptu jam sessions taking place in the courtyard.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I loved this unique hotel I stayed at this funky find Aug. 2003 and I had the time of my life. This hotel is fun and unique. Iam actualy planing on having my wedding there!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: charming place for the price I have stayed at this place many times before. I also have stayed elsewhere in the french quarter. Yes, other hotels are nicer, but also a lot more costly. This place is good, especially for the price. If you run into some problems, the staff is willing to work with you, to make you happy. they are knowlegable about the area, and in general really nice people to talk to. Some of them have been there over 30 years since it opened. You can't beat the location. This is my favorite place to come back to, for the price, the people, and the charm of it. It is an old townhome converted into a hotel, and all the rooms are different. I had a great time here, had my problems taken care of, was happy with the price, and even had them provide babysitters. I will always come back here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pretty low-rent... Spent a week at the Olivier House in December 2003. We are not picky folks, but we do expect a CLEAN room for $100 per night. We didn't get that. Also, I had been told our rate would be $90 per night over the phone, but since I didn't get that in writing, when we checked out they said the rate was $100. I tried to argue, and even said that the unclean, dilapidated room was NOT worth $100 per night, the clerk just said whoever took the reservation must have made a mistake, but they were charging my credit card for $100 per night.So, if you aren't too hip on clean carpet, unsoiled ceilings, and fresh bed linens SOMETIME in a 6-night stay, go for this place. But get your room rate quote IN WRITING.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Like on off-beat place, but this is too much We checked into the Olivier House for our honeymoon...in what was called the honeymoon suite. It was an unusually cold weekend in NO. There was no heat at al in the room, the toilet didn't flush and the bathroom smelled like a porta-pot. We decided to make the best of things and turned on the fireplace which filled the hall and our room with gas. We had to move to another (SMALL!) attic room on the fourth floor where we were not able to take a shower-or use a toilet. They The major problem here is that nobody seemed even mildly apologetic that we had so many problems and this was our honeymoon. I would never stay here again and I do like a laid-back hotel with loads of personality, but this was just bad.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The real New Orleans. A great stay. Was inexpensive especially compared to other hotels I called. (the hotel next door was $200 more for a smaller room!) Staff are friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Funky  Friendly, fun place to stay, nice people here. Close to everything. this is what the French Quarter is all about. We enjoyed our stay here. Go stay at the Marriott or similar hotel if you must, but if you came to enjoy New Orleans stay at a hotel like this one.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't Waste Your Money I have never been as disapointed in a hotel as I was in the OH. This place was a mess!! I am sure in it's day it was a great place to stay however it is terriable condition now. This place needs to close for some major remodeling. Who wants hear saws and walk through saw dust and dodge all of the construction while walking to your room. The room was covered in mold and mildew. The bath room was nasty and towels felt like sandpaper. Please don't waste over $400.00 on this dump like we did.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: My car was wrecked   showReview(1424347, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No place for squares. Looking through some of the other reviews, I am not surprised to find that some people disliked the Olivier House. It's not for everyone. Specifically, it's not for uptight or uncool people. The place is laid back, they do business differently from the usual robotic\cookie cutter type hotel. I've stayed at the olivier house many times, and it's definitely my favorite hotel in the french quarter.The staff are great, the price and location are good, and it's got something you can't get at some chain hotel, character. I've never had a problem there that the staff didn't fix right away. People who have no sense of adventure need not apply! You might see a ghost!
